assignments.assignment_description: Communicates and connects mathematical ideas using appropriate terminology, diagrams and symbols.
assignments.subject: Mathematics

assignments.assignment_description: Students are given a number of diagrams representing the modelling of a geometric pattern. They draw a diagram to represent their construction of the next structure required to continue the pattern. They then complete a table of values and determine a rule to describe the pattern, providing an explanation of how they obtained the rule.
assignments.subject: Mathematics

subjects.subject_name: Personal Development, Health and Physical Education

assignments.assignment_description: Students read each scenario and provide a written response suggesting a strategy for coping with this situation.
assignments.subject: Personal Development, Health and Physical Education

assignments.assignment_description: Students form pairs from different groups and teach their poem to the other member of the pair.  They write an individual response to the two poems explaining what each poem is about and how personification and other poetic techniques contribute to their understanding and enjoyment of the poems.
assignments.subject: English

assignments.assignment_description: Students compose a short narrative in response to one of a selection of stimulus items related to the concept of the monster which has been the focus of recent study.
assignments.subject: English

assignments.assignment_description: Students work independently or collaboratively to create a presentation illustrating their understanding and interpretation of the stimulus statement. Stimulus statement - Our everyday lives are affected by global connections
assignments.subject: Geography

assignments.assignment_description: Students research some of the holidays and festivals of the Middle Ages and compare their relevance to medieval and modern Australian society.
assignments.subject: History
